language.entry: De l'aide quand vous voulez !
Tuer l'ennemi !
Carte de Navigation
Mouvement
Objets Interactifs
Bandage
Soigner l'Infection
La Torche
Provisions pour l'Expedition
Changer les Competences de Combat
Changer les Competences de Campement
Bois et Campement
Les Avantages du Campement
Soulager le Stress
Affligé !
Vertueux !
Porte de la Mort
La discretion est la meilleure partie de la bravoure...
Neutraliser les Pieges
Entrer dans les Portes
Stress
Breloques
Formation du Groupe
Gain de Niveau !
La Diligence est votre fournisseur de sang frais

A chaque écran du jeu vous pouvez appuyez et maintenir [H] pour avec l'aide contextuelle.
Essayez quand vous serez en ville, en exploration, pendant un combat, un campement etc.

Les combats sont au tour par tour. Au tour de vos héros, [CLIQUER] sur une compétences et ensuite [CLIQUER] sur votre cible.
Si vous ne pouvez sélectionner une compétences, c'est parce que votre héros ne se trouve pas à la bonne position ou qu'il n'a pas de cibles valides. [Survoler] la compétence pour voir ses prérequis.

Vous etes dans une salle.
Pour avancer, [CLIQUER] sur une salle dans la mini-carte. Cela aura pour effet de vous mettre dans le couloir y menant.

Dans un couloir, appuyez sur [D] pour avancer et sur [A] pour reculer.
Si vous préférez la souris, vous pouvez [CLIQUER] devant ou à l'arrière du groupe pour le déplacer.
Pendant votre exploration, vous trouverez souvent des objets intéractifs. [CLIQUER] ou appuyez sur [W] pour les fouiller. Jetez un oeil à cette tente...

Votre héros saigne !
Si vous le souhaitez, vous pouvez utilisez un bandage dans votre inventaire pour arrêter l'hémoragie. [CLIC-DROIT] sur le bandage pendant le tour du héros blessé.

Votre heros est infecte!
Si vous le désirez, vous pouvez utiliser un anti-venin dans votre inventaire pour neutraliser l'infection. [CLIC-DROIT] sur l'anti-venin pendant le tour du héros infecté.

La torche s'estompe ! Le niveau de lumière affecte grandement beaucoup de mécanques de jeu. Plus il fait sombre, plus les choses deviennent difficiles mais meilleure sont les récompenses. [CLIC-DROIT] sur une torche dans votre inventaire pour augmenter votre jauge de lumière.

Vous devrez prendre différentes provisions en fonction de la région où vous allez et du temps qu'elle nécessite et de vos préférences. Mais emportez toujours de la nourriture et des torches !
Pour votre première petite quête, prenez au moins 8 vivres 4 torches.
Les Héros peuvent avoir quatre compétences de combat. Cliquez sur les compétences et regardez comment ce qu'il se produit sur l'écran ci-dessus !
Les Héros peuvent avoir trois compétences de campement. Activez/désactivez-les en cliquant dessus.

Cette quête implique un campement et un campement nécessite du bois. Le Bois vous est donné automatiquement pour les quêtes en nécessitant.
Le Feu de Camp donne au héros une chance de récupérer pendant un donjon. Lorsque vous êtes blessé ou stressé et que vous voulez faire un campement, [CLIC-DROIT] sur le Bois dans votre inventaire.

Un campement se décompose en deux parties: la phase de Repas et de la phase de Compétence.
Pendant la phase de Repas, vous choisissez les rations qui déterminent la récupération de vie. Assurez-vous d'avoir assez de nourriture !
La phase de Compétence vous permet de dépenser des Points de Repos sur les différentes compétences de campement.

Heroes relieve stress by taking part in activities at the Tavern and Abbey. Each activity has different side-effects.
Experiment to find the best activity for each hero, depending on their quirks!
Commiting a hero to an activity [LOCKS THEM IN THAT ACTIVITY] until the next Week. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

When heroes can't take the stress any more, they become afflicted. This manifests in different behaviors and stat changes. Afflictions last until you send them to treatment in town, unless you can reduce their stress to zero during the quest.

Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of stress by becoming heroic!
This elevated state of performance will last until they camp or return to town, and confers stat bonuses and other benefits.

When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at "Death's Door."
While in this state, they will suffer stat penalties, plus any further damage has a chance to kill them.
Heal them to get off Death's Door!

The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of retreating from combat and abandoning this quest to save the others, or press onward.
The choice is yours. [If this is the tutorial, retreat is unavailable.]

Scouted traps will be visible on the ground as you approach them. Select a hero and then [CLICK] on the trap to attempt to disarm it.
Some heroes are better than others at disarming.
To enter a door, [CLICK] or press [W] when standing in front of it.
Many actions and experiences cause stress. Stress damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. Stress can also be healed, and that appears in white type.

Each hero has room to equip two items, called "trinkets." Just drag the trinket from inventory over to the selected hero's slot. Trinkets generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also class-specific.

Each quest has different goals and rewards, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works!
However, it's recommended to bring along a Vestal or an Occultist for healing.

Heroes gain Resolve XP for each successful quest. Resolve XP in turn determines the hero's Resolve Level.
Resolve Level represents the hero's veteranship, and directly acts as Stress Resistance against the horrors encountered in the dungeons.
A low Resolve Level hero that tries a higher level quest will quickly crumble under the unimaginable stresses.

You'll need to recruit these two heroes to fill out a party of four. [Drag and drop] them into your roster.
While you're here, spend some of your starting resources on UPGRADING the Stagecoach network. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future.
To upgrade, click the [+] symbol on the left, and then click the upgrade.
[RIGHT-CLICK] on a hero in the roster to inspect their detailed character sheet. They can be renamed or dismissed permanently from there.
[CLICK] on buildings to use them to interact with your heroes.
STAGECOACH: recruit new heroes
BLACKSMITH: upgrade heroes' weapons and armor
GUILD: upgrade heroes' combat skills
SURVIVALIST: upgrade heroes' camping skills
TAVERN: send heroes for stress relief
ABBEY: send heroes for stress relief
SANITARIUM: treat heroes' negative quirks and diseases
NOMAD'S WAGON: purchase rare items
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[RIGHT-CLICK] on new heroes to inspect them.
[DRAG] new heroes to your roster to recruit them.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[DRAG] a hero from your roster into the Blacksmith to see their weapon and armor upgrade options.
[CLICK] on upgrades to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Blacksmith before purchasing some hero upgrades.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[DRAG] a hero from your roster into the Guild to see their skill upgrade options.
[CLICK] on skills or upgrades to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Guild before purchasing some hero upgrades.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[CLICK] on a hero in your roster to load them into the Guild and see their combat skill upgrade options.
[CLICK] on skills or upgrades to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Survivalist before purchasing some hero upgrades.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[DRAG] a hero into the appropriate slot to start a stress-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, stress relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.
[SHIFT-CLICK] on a building slot to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not recover the money spent.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[DRAG] a hero into the appropriate slot to start a stress-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, stress relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.
[SHIFT-CLICK] on a building slot to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not recover the money spent.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[DRAG] a hero into the treatment slot, select a quirk to remove, and then pay to begin treatment.
Committing the hero to treatment will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional treatment slots.
[SHIFT-CLICK] on a building slot to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not recover the money spent.
[CLICK] the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
[CLICK] on available items to purchase them.
[CLICK] on available quests to inspect them.
[CLICK] on heroes or [DRAG] them into the party slots to form an adventuring party.
Heroes that are in the Tavern, Abbey, or Sanitarium will be unavailable for use.
Complete quests in regions to advance your mastery in that region and open up new quest types.
[CLICK] "PROVISION" when ready to proceed.
[CLICK] items in the shop to purchase them for the expedition.
At quest end, unused provisions will be discarded without repayment. Buy only as much as you need!
You'll always want to carry some food and torches! Each hero generally eats 1 food unit per meal (camping or hunger event).
[CLICK] on a room in the map to begin moving to that room.
[CLICK] on a hero to select them.
[CLICK] on a hero's move skill to change their party position.
[CLICK] on firewood in inventory (if you have any) to start CAMPING.
[MOUSE OVER] the torch meter to see current light level and gameplay effects.
[CLICK] on retreat flag to abandon the quest.
While interacting with an object: [RIGHT-CLICK] an inventory item to apply it to the object. Some items will yield positive effects.
Use [MOUSEWHEEL] to zoom map and [RIGHT-CLICK] and [DRAG] to pan map.
[RIGHT-CLICK] a hero to see their detailed character sheet.
Press [D] to walk forward, [A] to walk backward.
[CLICK] on a hero's move skill to change their party position.
Entering Doors: When in front of a door, [CLICK] on it or press [W].
Use [MOUSEWHEEL] to zoom map and [RIGHT-CLICK] and [DRAG] to pan map.
[CLICK] on objects or press [W] to interact with them. The selected hero will perform the interaction.
[RIGHT-CLICK] a hero to see their detailed character sheet.
[CLICK] on the INVENTORY tab to examine supplies.
[CLICK] on the PERSONALITY tab to see the current hero's quirks and afflictions.
[CLICK] on the retreat flag to abandon the quest.
On hero's turn, [CLICK] a valid combat skill and then [CLICK] a target to act. You can also use [# keys] 1-5 to quickly select a skill.
Each skill has different requirements for where the hero needs to be standing and what enemies they can target. [MOUSE OVER] the skill to se the requirements.
[MOUSE OVER] enemies to see stats and chances to hit/damage/crit with currently selected skill.
[RIGHT-CLICK] on Anti-Venom or Bandages in inventory to heal BLIGHT or BLEED on the current hero.
[CLICK] on Retreat Flag to attempt to retreat from the combat.
[RIGHT-CLICK] on a hero to see their detailed character sheet.
[CLICK] on meal options to choose how much to eat. You are limited by how much food you have in inventory.
Your party has [10 ACTION POINTS] to spend on using camping skills.
[CLICK] on a hero and then [CLICK] on their skill to use it. Some skills require a target to be selected.
When done spending ACTION POINTS, [CLICK] "REST" to finish camping.
The Ruins bear all the signs of your Ancestor's frenzied digging...
Once-holy idols and shrines have been corrupted to favor pagan gods. Holy Water can help restore them to their rightful condition.
The undead will not bleed, but they can be blighted.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...
Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
The Weald is full of long, winding paths. Bring plenty of torches.
Beware the mark of death that Fungal Artillery can put on you. It tells their Fungal Zombie brethren what to kill.
The paths are littered with poisonous traps.
Beast and corrupted human alike inhabit these failing groves.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...
Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
The Warrens is full of disease and blight in equal measure... come prepared to deal with sickness.
The Swine are resistant to disease, thanks to their unclean living.
These tunnels are often blocked by piled stones and bodies. It's dirty work to remove by hand.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...
Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
